about.description: A ripper mobile app for intervals.icu. Suss out your activities, check your training load, and track your fitness, all from your phone.
about.disclaimer: Veloq is an independent, open-source project. We're not affiliated with, endorsed by, or connected to intervals.icu in any way. intervals.icu is a trademark of its respective owner.
about.garminNote: Activity data may include info from Garmin devices. Garmin and the Garmin logo are trademarks of Garmin Ltd. or its subsidiaries.
about.mapAttribution: Map tiles are provided by the legends at OpenStreetMap under the Open Database License. Map data © OpenStreetMap contributors.
about.title: About & Legal bits

activity.chartHint: Hold to scrub • Hold chip for axis

explanations.conditions: Temperature from the weather or your gadget's sensor.
explanations.energy: Roughly how many kilojoules you burned based on heart rate, power, and how long you went.
explanations.heartRate: Your average ticker rate during the activity.
explanations.trainingLoad: Training Stress Score (TSS) shows how hard you went based on duration and intensity relative to your threshold.
explanations.yourForm: Your Form (TSB) on this day. It's your overall training form, not just this activity. TSB = Fitness (CTL) minus Fatigue (ATL).

activityDetail.noMatchedSectionsDescription: Sections matching this activity will rock up here
activityDetail.noRouteMatchDescription: Do this route a few more times to start tracking your performance, or expand your timeline in Settings to include older activities.

alerts.cacheCorruptionMessage: Local data stash got munted and had to be cleared. Your data will be grabbed fresh from the server.
alerts.clearCacheMessage: This'll clear all your cached data, tracks, and route matching stuff, then reload. Might take a few minutes.
alerts.clearRouteCacheMessage: This'll clear all route matching data and get straight into re-analysing tracks.
alerts.disconnectMessage: This'll chuck your API credentials. You'll need to enter them again to use the app.
alerts.failedToClear: Couldn't clear the cache. Have another crack.
alerts.syncAllMessage: This'll sync up to 10 years of activity data in the background. Gives you better route analysis and comparison.

attribution.demoData: Demo mode uses real activity traces. Used with permission from the author.
attribution.garminTrademark: Garmin and the Garmin logo are trademarks of Garmin Ltd.

backup.exportError: Couldn't ship out the backup, sorry mate.
backup.importError: Couldn't bring in the backup, sorry mate.
backup.nothingToRestore: Nothing in that backup file, mate.

cache.noValidGpsData: No valid GPS data in fixtures

common.showDetails: Show the guts for the dev

networkError.description: Check your internet and have another crack
networkError.title: Can't get through

noActivities.description: Your activities will rock up here once you sync with Intervals.icu
noActivities.title: No activities yet, mate

noData.description: Get out there and do some activities to see your stats
noData.title: No data yet

noResults.description: Try tweaking your search or filters
noResults.title: Couldn't find anything

offline.description: Some stuff might not work out bush
offline.title: You've gone walkabout

errorState.defaultMessage: Couldn't grab the data, mate. Give it another go.

export.error: Couldn't export that GPX file, sorry mate.
export.bulkResult: {{exported}} GPX files shipped, {{skipped}} activities without GPS skipped.

fitnessScreen.fatigueDescription: is a 7-day rolling average of how hard you've been going.
fitnessScreen.fitnessDescription: is a 42-day rolling average of how hard you've been going.
fitnessScreen.forRaces: for races. Steer clear of the
fitnessScreen.formDescription: is fitness minus how cooked you are. Train in the
fitnessScreen.title: Fitness & Form

licenses.footer: Tap any licence badge to suss out the full licence text. Tap the link icon to check out the project repo.
licenses.intro: Veloq is built with open-source software. This screen lists the third-party libraries and their licences, fair dinkum.
licenses.title: Third-Party Licences

login.apiKeyConnect: Hook me up with API Key
login.apiKeyDescription: For local-only mode. Your key stays put on your device.
login.apiKeyPlaceholder: Chuck your API key in here
login.apiKeyRequired: You'll need an API key, mate
login.connectionFailed: Couldn't connect, mate. Check your API key and give it another go.
login.createAccountHint: Sign up for free to track your training.
login.disclaimer: Veloq is not affiliated with intervals.icu
login.instructions:
1. Open Intervals.icu Settings
2. Scroll down to "Developer Settings"
3. Copy your API Key
login.invalidApiKey: That API key's no good, mate. Double-check it and try again.
login.localModeNote: Local mode: All your data stays on your device
login.oauthFailed: Sign in didn't work. Have another crack.
login.oauthNotConfigured: OAuth isn't set up yet. Use API key login instead.
login.oauthStateValidationFailed: Security check failed. Give signing in another go.
login.securityNote: Your details are safe as houses on your device
login.sessionExpired: Your session's run out. Sign in again, mate.
login.sessionRevoked: Your access was pulled. Sign in again.
login.subtitle: Hook up to Intervals.icu
login.title: Veloq

maps.fitAllHint: Long press to fit all your rides on the map
maps.showMyLocationHint: Whips the map over to where you are right now

routes.adjustSportTypeFilter: Try tweaking the sport type filter
routes.checkingActivities: Step 1: Having a squiz at {{count}} activities...
routes.duplicateNameMessage: Give it another name, mate. Each route needs a unique one.
routes.expandTimeline: Stretch out the timeline to crunch more activities. Route matching will keep chugging along in the background.
routes.firstRunHint: Do this route again to see how you're tracking over time
routes.frequentSectionsInfo: Frequent sections are bits of road you hit up heaps, spotted automatically from your tracks.
routes.potentialSectionDescription: You've smashed this {{sport}} path {{count}} times. Wanna create a section to track how you're going?
routes.routesWillAppear: Routes will rock up once we've had a squiz at your activities
routes.routesWithTwoPlus: Routes with 2+ activities on similar paths will rock up here
routes.sectionCreatedDescription: Ripper! Your section's been created and activities matched
routes.sectionCreationFailed: Couldn't create the section. Have another crack.
routes.sectionLargeWarning: That's a big section - might slow things down
routes.sectionTooLarge: Section's too big, mate. Pick a shorter bit.
routes.sectionTooLargeWarning: Section might be too big to stash
routes.sectionTooLargeWithHint: Section's too big. Try making it at least {{reduction}} shorter.
routes.sectionsDescription: Sections are spotted when you've done the same roads a few times, even on different routes
routes.gpsTrackNotSynced: GPS data's not here yet. Hang tight for the sync to finish and give it another crack.
routes.invalidSectionRange: That selection's no good. Try picking a different bit.
routes.shareDetailsWithDeveloper: Copy the details and flick them to the dev if you're reporting a drama

routesScreen.enableInSettings: Flick on route matching in Settings to automatically spot routes you've done before.
routesScreen.title: Routes

sections.deleteSectionConfirm: You sure you want to chuck this section? Can't undo this one.
sections.disableSectionConfirm: This section will be hidden from activity details. You can turn it back on later from the sections list.
sections.duplicateNameMessage: Give it another name, mate. Each section needs a unique one.
sections.groupingDescription: Show your best effort per time period
sections.scrubHintScrollable: Swipe to scroll • Hold to flick through
sections.setAsReferenceConfirm:
Use this one as the reference?

The section will be re-matched against all your activities. Might add or chuck out some activities.
sections.setReferenceError: Couldn't set the reference. Something might've changed. Have another crack.
sections.resetReferenceConfirm:
Go back to automatic reference?

The section will be re-matched against all your activities. Might add or chuck out some activities.

settings.cacheHint: Stashes your activity locations and tracks for the World Map and route matching. Use the timeline to grab more.
settings.clearAllReloadDescription: This'll chuck all your cached data, tracks, and route matching stuff, then reload the lot. Might take a few minutes.
settings.clearRouteDescription: This'll clear all the route matching data and get straight into re-analysing your tracks.
settings.dataSourcesDescription: Your activity and wellness data comes from intervals.icu, which hooks into heaps of fitness platforms and devices.
settings.disconnectDescription: This'll chuck your API credentials from the app. You'll need to enter them again to use it.
settings.metricsHint: Flick metrics on/off and shuffle them with the arrows. Only the ones turned on show up top.
settings.primarySportHint: Changes what shows up on your home screen and stats page.
settings.primarySportHintCycling: FTP shows up top. Performance page has your Power Curve, power zones, eFTP trend, and decoupling.
settings.primarySportHintRunning: Threshold pace and LTHR show up top. Performance page has your Pace Curve, running power, and ticker zones.
settings.primarySportHintSwimming: CSS (Critical Swim Speed) shows up top. Performance page has your Swim Pace Curve and ticker zones.
settings.routeMatchingDescription: Automatically spot routes you've done before from your activities
settings.syncAllHistoryDescription: This'll sync up to 10 years of activity data in the background. Gives you better route analysis and comparison, mate.
settings.syncInProgress: Hang on, the current sync's still going.
settings.title: Settings
settings.unitsAutoHint: Uses your device's regional settings to sort out units
settings.unitsImperialHint: Distances in miles, height in feet, temp in Fahrenheit
settings.unitsMetricHint: Distances in kays, height in metres, temp in Celsius

stats.addEventsHint: Chuck some events on intervals.icu to see them here
stats.completeActivitiesHeatmap: Get out there and do some activities to see your calendar heatmap
stats.completeActivitiesHr: Do some activities with heart rate to see zone distribution
stats.completeActivitiesPower: Do some activities with a power meter to see zone distribution
stats.completeActivitiesYearComparison: Get some activities done to see year-over-year comparison
stats.completeDecouplingHint: Do a proper sustained effort with power and HR to see decoupling analysis
stats.completePowerActivities: Do some power-based activities to see your FTP trend
stats.createWorkoutsHint: Whip up some workouts on intervals.icu to see them here
stats.decouplingExplanation: Decoupling measures cardiac drift - how much your ticker works harder relative to power during sustained efforts. Lower is better, means your aerobic engine is running smooth.
stats.noActivitiesInPeriod: No activities in this period, mate
stats.noSwimPaceData: No swim pace data yet, mate

statsScreen.garminNote: Charts might include data from your Garmin
statsScreen.title: How you're going
statsScreen.paceCurveInfo: CS (critical speed) and D' are worked out using the 2 parameter model. Intervals.icu grabs your best 1k, 2k, 3k, 4k and 5k times that take between 2 and 15+ minutes.
statsScreen.powerCurveInfo: Estimated FTP is worked out using power curves from FastFitness.Tips and Morton's 3 parameter critical power model. Just needs 1 flat-out effort between 180 seconds and 30 minutes. W' is relative to eFTP.

trainingScreen.disabledInSettings: Turned off - Flick it on in Settings
trainingScreen.title: Training

wellness.connectHint: Chuck on a wearable or log some data in Intervals.icu
wellness.insightGoodRecovery: Ripper recovery - you're an absolute weapon
wellness.smoothingDescription: Chuck on a rolling average to smooth out the bumps and show trends better.
wellness.smoothingHint: Auto picks the best smoothing for the time range
wellness.trendHint: HRV, kip, and resting HR trends will rock up here when you log some data
